title: IAM Policy Challenges 3
help: This slide highlights the common challenges in IAM policy management: over-privileged access being the default, manual policy creation being unscalable, and the need for comprehensive audit trails. The example shows a typical overly permissive policy that grants full access.

title: Automated Policy Generation
help: This slide demonstrates our automated policy generation solution. The Python code shows how we analyze CloudTrail logs to determine actual resource usage and generate minimal required permissions. The system tracks user actions over 30 days to build accurate policy recommendations.

code.content:
# Policy analyzer
def analyze_cloudtrail_logs(user_arn):
    events = get_user_events(user_arn, days=30)
    actions = extract_actions(events)
    return generate_minimal_policy(actions)

policy = analyze_cloudtrail_logs("arn:aws:iam::123:user/dev")
print(json.dumps(policy, indent=2))

title: System Architecture
help: This slide outlines the system architecture for our IAM policy management solution. It shows how we process events, track permissions in real-time, and generate compliance reports. The architecture is designed to be scalable and maintainable.

title: Implementation Results
help: This slide presents the concrete results of implementing our automated IAM policy solution. The metrics show significant improvements in security posture, including reduced over-privileged access, faster policy deployment, and improved compliance rates.
text:
After implementing automated least-privilege IAM policies across our infrastructure, we achieved significant improvements in security posture.

Key metrics include 85% reduction in over-privileged access, 60% faster policy deployment, and 100% compliance audit success rate.

The system now automatically analyzes CloudTrail logs, generates minimal policies, and provides continuous monitoring for policy drift.
